page.title: 20THE COMMUNITY TUTOR
page.content: The origin of the position of Community Tutor based within a secondary school, lies in the belief that the institution operates as a {Community Resource}in the widest sense of the term. The school is a natural focal point within any geographical area, and also contains plant, equipment, facilities and staff expertise which should be available for use by{all}within its catchment area both during{and}outside the usual school day. The job of the Community Tutor is to facilitate this link between the school and its community both on and off site. Any school clearly has a role in encouraging and supporting independent initiatives, such as youth clubs or women's groups and the Tutor must work in both a formal and informal manner with a wide range of individuals and groups.
